topic.title: Abstract

body.p: The Datapath Central Packet Buffer (DCPB) contains channel multiplexers, a 2x2 non-blocking channelized packet switch (SCPB), and storage. The channel mux block combines traffic from the SAR, MAPOTN, and ENET subsystems for a combined total of 500 Gbps into SCPB push port 1. Similarly, the channel demux block distributes 500 Gbps from pop port 1 to the SAR, MAPOTN, and ENET subsystems. The COPIPIF subsystem is connected directly to the other SCPB port. The SCPB contains four sets of logical FIFOs (port pairs). Push ports write data into per-channel FIFOs that are read by the pop port. Memory for the FIFOs is allocated from the storage block (PMPM). All connections between channels from an input port to an output port are unicast. Broadcast and multicast connections between an input channel and output channel are not supported in the DCPB. The PMPM is organized in pages and blocks. A given page can be assigned to any port pair. A given block can be assigned to any channel within the port pair. The size of a channel FIFO is determined by the number of blocks allocated to it.
